intro: Tecomaria petersii, commonly known as the African jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for both container gardening and landscape use. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
